case.name: SZDTN v Minister for Immigration & Multicultural & Indigenous [2006] FCA 175 (3 March 2006)

citphrases.citphrase: re commonwealth of australia & anor; ex parte marks practice and procedure
factors to be considered. constitutional law
whether full bench of australian industrial relations commission made a jurisdictional error
role of full bench on appeal. practice and procedure
whether s 347 of the workplace relations act 1996 (cth) applied
whether proceedings commenced "vexatiously or without reasonable cause".
re refugee review tribunal; ex parte aala immigration
prosecutor denied opportunity to be heard on matters affecting credibility
whether prosecutor denied possibility of a successful outcome. administrative law
nature of constitutional writ of prohibition
availability of writ of prohibition for failure to accord procedural fairness
whether prohibition available as of right or by discretion
whether application should be rejected due to delay. constitutional law
meaning to be given to words in s 75(v)
relevance of meaning at time of commencement of constitution .
standing as australian citizen of infant daughter of aliens
review of refugee review tribunal decision
refusal of a protection (class xa) visa

citances.sentence: Mr Potts submits that the unwarrantable delay of more than a year in commencing these proceedings is sufficient to justify the Court denying relief in the exercise of its discretion: R v Commonwealth Court of Conciliation and Arbitration; Ex parte Ozone Theatres (Aust) Ltd [1949] HCA 33 ; (1949) 78 CLR 389 at 400; SZDSJ v Minister for Immigration [2005] FMCA 160 at [14] --- [17]; SZDTN v Minister for Immigration [2005] FMCA 1293 at [45] --- [60] (upheld on appeal SZDTN v Minister for Immigration [2006] FCA 175 at [16] ); SZGPZ v Minister for Immigration [2006] FMCA 194 at [75] --- [77]; and SZGTA v Minister for Immigration [2006] FMCA 648 at [61] --- [67].
